channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Vult at OpenFest Bulgaria
item.description:
Last november I attended to the OpenFest 2016 in Bulgaria where I presented an overview of Vult.

OpenFest is the biggest conference in Bulgaria focused on open technologies. The conference is held in Sofia. This is the second time I attend but the first time presenting there.

You can find the complete video of my presentation here:

In addition to the demos that I showed there. I also prepared a version of the closing song where I explain with more detail what happens in the screen.

You can find the code, models and patches in the following repository: Vult Examples

item.title: Vult
item.description:
Vult is a simple programming language made to produce high-performance algorithms that can run on small processors like Arduinos.

Vult provides features that simplify developing DSP algorithms, for example audio effects and synthesizers.

item.title: Using Arduinos as SystemModeler Components
item.description: This is a post in the Wolfram blog. It presents the ModelPlug library for SystemModeler.

item.title: Design and Optimization of Power Delivery and Distribution Systems Using Evolutionary Computation Techniques
item.description: This is my full PhD. thesis converted to HTML and presented as a single page.

item.title: Platform for fast evaluation and optimization of power systems
item.description: This is a short version of my thesis where I present the full platform.

item.title: Fast architecture generation and evaluation techniques for the design of large power systems
item.description: This paper focused in techniques used to automatically generate power architectures.

item.title: Power conversion modeling methodology based on building block models
item.description: Here I presented modeling methodologies to characterize power converters. In addition, I presented the tool to simplify capturing and generating models.

item.title: Generalized methodology for the analysis and design of multiphase converters with integrated magnetics
item.description: Here I presented the modeling and analysis of some cool magnetic core structures that I came up with.

item.title: About
item.description:
Iâ€™m was born in Mexico in the state of Guanajuato. I got my first degree there, and later I moved to Spain to continue my studies.

Currently live in Sweden where I work at Wolfram. I develop the simulation core of SystemModeler.

In my free time I produce music and make software and hardware related to sound synthesis.

You can find me in Linkedin at Leonardo Laguna Ruiz

item.title: Pla
item.description:
Pla is an OCaml library and ppx syntax extension to create composable templates based on verbatim strings.

Pla creates (at compile-time) fast and easy templates that can be filled out to generate complex text.

item.title: ModelPlug
item.description: ModelPlug is a library for SystemModeler. ModelPlug allows you to connect simulation models with Arduino boards and use them to input/output signals.
